newsitem.title: USA: CSCE world sugar ends firmer but still in range.
newsitem.headline: CSCE world sugar ends firmer but still in range.

text.p: CSCE world sugar futures closed higher on the day but prices remained stuck in their recent trading range with no fundamental news to inspire any significant movement.
Traders said producer selling at 11.50 cents in October and at 11.80 cents in March, and trade scale-down buying kept the market confined to an 11-point trading range.
October rose 0.06 cent on the day to 11.55 cents a lb, having ranged from 11.57 to 11.48 cents. The rest of the board settled 0.01 to 0.06 cent firmer.
Nearby resistance remained at 11.58 followed by 11.87 cents in October. Support was pegged at the recent low of 11.32 cents.
An estimated 9,887 lots changed hands compared with Wednesday's official 16,358 lots.
